meanings.definition: The study of rock layers and their relationships.
meanings.sent1: In stratigraphies, scientists examine how different rock layers are connected.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use stratigraphies to understand the history of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphies class was so interesting that even the rocks seemed to listen.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the stratigraphies of the Grand Canyon is like reading a history book written in stone.
meanings.sent5: Through detailed stratigraphies, researchers can uncover ancient secrets hidden beneath the surface.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of sedimentary rocks in layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphies of the quarry revealed the different sedimentary layers.
meanings.sent2: The stratigraphies of the cliffs showed the gradual deposition of rocks over time.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphies looked like a giant rock sandwich with many layers.
meanings.sent4: The stratigraphies resembled a colorful cake with each layer representing a different era.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphies displayed a beautiful pattern of sedimentary rocks stacked one upon the other.

meanings.definition: The analysis of the order and position of layers of rock.
meanings.sent1: Through detailed stratigraphies, researchers can determine the sequence of rock layers.
meanings.sent2: Stratigraphies help geologists understand the relative ages of different rock formations.
meanings.sent3: The detective used the concept of stratigraphies to solve the mystery of the missing rocks.
meanings.sent4: The stratigraphies acted as a roadmap, guiding scientists through the history of the Earth.
meanings.sent5: By studying the stratigraphies, experts can piece together the puzzle of geological events.
